intro: Nasturtium persicum, commonly known as the common nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Tropaeolaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of orange, red, and yellow. The plant is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, featuring heart-shaped leaves and edible parts, including the flowers and seeds. Its botanical name reflects its historical association with Persia, and it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes as well as for its culinary uses.
